page.title: 20WITHINGTON ROMAN VILLA
page.content: The Roman Villa lies buried, in a field, to the west of the Chedworth road. The date of the building is not known for certain but is thought to be {2nd Century.}It was most probably a farm as the Latin word suggests. The beautiful mosaic floors were removed to the{British Museum.}The Villa is believed to be smaller but similar to the famous Chedworth Roman Villa. {DISTINGUISHED RESIDENTS.} The Rt.Hon.W.S.Morrison M.C.,Q.C.,M.P. (1893-1961) lived in Withington for many years.He was Conservative member for Cirencester and Tewkesbury for 30 years.He held several ministerial appointments and was elected Speaker of the House of Commons in 1951 and for his distiguished service he was made a peer.His daughter in law Lady Mavis Dunrossil is a county councillor for the Northleach division.
